title: Respect for Blood and Sacrifice
summary: Leviticus 17 emphasizes that all sacrifices must be brought to the tabernacle and warns against eating blood. Blood represents life and is sacred to God, being used for atonement.

faq.question: Why was eating blood forbidden?
faq.answer: Because the life is in the blood, and it is given for atonement on the altar.

faq.question: Where were sacrifices required to be offered?
faq.answer: Only at the tabernacle, to prevent idolatry and maintain proper worship.
